questions.question_text:
An office computer has been infected with malware.
Which of the following steps should be taken FIRST?

discussion.content: D. aka his email got hijacked

questions.question_text:
Joe, a user, is getting out-of-office replies from people he did not email. A technician inspects Joe's inbox and sees a sent email that appears to have come from
Joe. The email contains a link to a well-known company's website, which is spelled incorrectly. Joe's sent items folder shows dozens of emails that were sent to everyone on his contact list.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of this issue?

choices.B: Joe inadvertently triggered a mail merge
choices.A: Joe was the victim of a man-in-the-middle attack

discussion.content: I would stick with C. The question says, "the contents" of all corporate machines - not just preventing unauthorized access. To me this would need to include HD encryption, scheduled system and AV updates, IDS, ect. to remain compliant. All these things can be tracked by an endpoint server that would flag non-compliant machines.
I would have chosen B then C because its asking for the protection of those devices...

Selected Answer: C
Compliance is financial industry (SEC) and has nothing to do with IT.

questions.question_text: Which of the following must a systems administrator employ to protect the contents of all corporate machines?

comments.content: Agreed A, F. By the way...can't thank you enough for taking your time to help on almost all the questions. Cheers!

discussion.content: I think A and F, not C...

Selected Answer: AF
Enable multifactor authentication for each support account (Option A):
Multifactor authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of security by requiring users to provide multiple forms of identification before granting access. This helps protect accounts even if passwords are compromised.

Enforce account lockouts after five bad password attempts (Option F):
Implementing account lockouts after a certain number of unsuccessful password attempts can help mitigate the risk of brute force attacks by temporarily blocking access to the account after repeated failed login attempts.

These measures enhance the security posture of the bank by strengthening access controls and reducing the likelihood of unauthorized access through brute force attacks. The other options may have some benefits, but enabling multifactor authentication and enforcing account lockouts are particularly effective in addressing the specific risks outlined in the scenario.

Selected Answer: AF
Agree with AF

choices.A: Enable multifactor authentication for each support account.
choices.B: Limit remote access to destinations inside the corporate network.
choices.C: Block all support accounts from logging in from foreign countries.
choices.F: Enforce account lockouts after five bad password attempts.
choices.D: Configure a replacement remote-access tool for support cases.
choices.E: Purchase a password manager for remote tool users.

questions.question_text:
The Chief Executive Officer at a bank recently saw a news report about a high-profile cybercrime where a remote access tool that the bank uses for support was also used in this crime. The report stated that attackers were able to brute force passwords to access systems.
Which of the following would BEST limit the bank's risk? (Choose two.)

comments.content: Purpose of the change should already been included before the update/change which leaves to A

discussion.content: I'm torn between A and B. Obviously it would make sense to immediately document the data and time but on Professor Messer's site he says "After the change has been applied, you need to make sure that everyone knows what has changed in the organization. There may be documentation at the help desk that you can update showing the new version numbers or the new server names of what was changed.", which would feel more in line with B.

questions.question_text:
A change advisory board authorized a setting change so a technician is permitted to implement the change. The technician successfully implemented the change.
Which of the following should be done NEXT?

choices.A: Document the date and time of change.
choices.D: Document findings of the sandbox test.
choices.B: Document the purpose of the change.
